tp:docstring.p: This interface extends the Text interface to support messages with attachments (like MIME multipart/mixed) and alternatives (like MIME multipart/alternative); it also provides a hook for improved sent message status notification, to be used by a future DeliveryNotification interface.

Although this specification supports formatted (rich-text) messages with unformatted alternatives, implementations SHOULD NOT attempt to use formatted messages until the Telepathy specification has also been extended to cover capability discovery for message formatting.
tp:docstring.tp:rationale: We intend to expose all rich-text messages as XHTML-IM, but on some protocols, formatting is an extremely limited subset of that format (e.g. there are protocols where foreground/background colours, font and size can be set, but only for entire messages). Until we can tell UIs what controls to offer to the user, it's unfriendly to offer the user controls that may have no effect.
